availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Hancock County, Kentucky, carpenter and miller. Tennessee native. Married to Rose Ann Davidson Shelley. Father of Mary B. Shelley, Annie T. Shelley, Clara Shelley, Carrie M. Shelley, Hattie Emma Shelley, Estelle Shelley, Geneva P. Shelley, and Hiram L. Shelley. Attended county schools in Gibson County, Tennessee. Carpenter in Hickman, Kentucky and Cannelton, Indiana. Moved to Hawesville, Kentucky, in 1852. Worked in the manufacturing of shingles and the distillery business starting from 1860 to 1866, when he opened a steam flouring-mill. Member of the Masonic Order at Hancock Lodge, No. 115 in Hawesville.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hancock County, Hawesville, p. 126-127.
J. H. Battle, W. H. Perrin, and G. C. Kniffin, Kentucky: A History of the State (Louisville: F. A. Battey Publishing Co., 1885), 757.
Proceedings of the Grand Lodge of Kentucky, at a Grand Annual Communication, in the City of Louisville, Commencing on Monday, the 21st Day of October, 1867 (Frankfort, Ky.: Frankfort Commonwealth, 1867), 111-112.
Find A Grave, "Zachary H. Shelley (1827-1899)," Memorial #89301426, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/89301426 (accessed April 6, 2017).
